New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Tigers lefty to record 200 strikeouts in a season, joining Mickey Lolich, Hal Newhouser and Matthew Boyd
Key Match Events: Tarik Skubal pitched a career-high eight innings, allowing just three singles after the first-inning home run and finishing with eight strikeouts
Ryan Kreidler made a great play to retire Triston Casas leading off the eighth inning
Zach McKinstry extended his hitting streak to a team-best 11 games with a double in the second inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers were celebrating the 40-year anniversary of the 1984 World Series championship, which gave the crowd a lively atmosphere
Post-Match Reflections: Tarik Skubal expressed his appreciation for the fans and the 1984 team, saying it was a great environment and the fans were great
Manager AJ Hinch praised Skubal's performance, saying he was very efficient and dominant
Skubal emphasized the importance of focusing on winning each day's game and not getting ahead of themselves
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers played stellar defensive behind Skubal, with several key plays to retire lead-off hitters
The game was played in front of a crowd of 34,355, one of the largest of the season
